description: Wiggle Wonderland is a touring pavilion activated by artists and communities. Created by architectural designer Beau McCarthy and artist Lucy Grainge, the pavilion is a timber-framed, open-air gallery. From hosting live performances to workshops, each install of the pavilion evolves and is shaped by people and place, and collaboration and co-creation are core to the project.

events.name: Drop in: Wiggle Wonderland Workshops - Croydon Urban Room
events.notes: Join Wiggle Wonderland for a family friendly workshop and explore ideas for a future Croydon town centre at Croydon Urban Room.

factsheet.heading: About
paragraphs: During Open House 2024, Wiggle Wonderland will host drop-in, family friendly workshops at Croydon Urban Room on the theme of dreams for a future Croydon town centre.

Come along and create artwork about Croydon's future for a public exhibition -  artwork created in these workshops will be exhibited on Wiggle Wonderland pavilion in public location in Croydon in October.

Wiggle Wonderland is a touring pavilion activated by artists and communities. Created by architectural designer Beau McCarthy and artist Lucy Grainge, the pavilion is a timber-framed, open-air gallery.

location.address: Croydon Urban Room, Units 161-162 & 1161-1162, Whitgift Centre

name: Wiggle Wonderland
